findings.title: Unchecked low-level call
findings.explanation: The contract uses `address.call(bytes4(sha3(...)))` without checking the return value, so failures or malicious reverts in the external call are ignored and may lead to unexpected behavior or fund loss.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a safer interface call and check the return value, e.g. `require(fuck.call(bytes4(keccak256("giveBlockReward()"))));`, or better yet define an interface and call `giveBlockReward()` directly.

findings.title: Unbounded loop with user-controlled iterations
findings.explanation: The `makeOldFucks` function loops based on the `number` parameter without any bounds, allowing callers to specify a very large value and potentially exhaust gas or cause the transaction to run out of gas.
findings.fix_suggestion: Enforce an upper limit on `number`, or split the work into smaller chunks (e.g., limit iterations per call), ensuring the function cannot be used to consume excessive gas.
